  14    def __init__(self,
  15                 prophet_influxdb_addon_url: str | None = None,
  16                 influx_db_url: str | None = None,
  17                 influx_db_user: str | None = None,
  18                 influx_db_pass: str | None = None,
  19                 influx_db_database: str | None = None,
  20                 acin_to_acout_sensor: str | None = None,
  21                 inverter_to_acout_sensor: str | None = None,
  22                 solar_production_sensor: str | None = None,
  23                 hystory_forecast_solar_sensor: str | None = None,
  24                 battery_capacity_Wh: int | None = None,
  25                 max_charge_energy_per_period_Wh: int | None = None,
  26                 max_discharge_energy_per_period_Wh: int | None = None,
  27                 max_buy_energy_per_period_Wh: int | None = None,
  28                 charge_efficiency: float | None = None,
  29                 discharge_efficiency: float | None = None,
  30                 battery_purchase_price: float | None = 0,
  31                 str_local_timezone: str | None = None,
  32                 enable_fore_to_real_correction: bool | None = False,
  33                 sell_allowed: bool | None = False
  34                ) -> None:
  35        
  36        """Initialize the API."""
  37        # Initialize the client for InfluxDB queries
  38        self._session = aiohttp.ClientSession()
  39
  40        # Set the local timezone
  41        # Note: Calls to df.index = df.index.tz_convert(tz) can be made using strings like 'Europe/Madrid'
  42        # However, it is preferred to use a pytz.timezone object which is more efficient
  43        # since the df_from_influxdb function makes intensive use of timezone conversion
  44        # Note: pytz is not compatible with asyncio, so it must be executed in a separate thread
  45        self.class_local_timezone = None
  46        asyncio.create_task(self.set_class_local_timezone(str_local_timezone))        
  47
  48        # Register initialization parameters
  49        # Prophet Addon
  50        self._prophet_influxdb_addon_url = prophet_influxdb_addon_url
  51
  52        # InfluxDB
  53        #self._influx_db_url='http://192.168.0.100:8086/query'
  54        # Ensure the InfluxDB URL ends with /query
  55        if influx_db_url is not None and not influx_db_url.endswith('/query'):
  56            influx_db_url = f"{influx_db_url.rstrip('/')}/query"
  57
  58        self._influx_db_url = influx_db_url
  59        self._influx_db_user = influx_db_user
  60        self._influx_db_pass = influx_db_pass
  61        self._influx_db_database = influx_db_database
  62        self._acin_to_acout_sensor = acin_to_acout_sensor
  63        self._solar_production_sensor = solar_production_sensor
  64        self._hystory_forecast_solar_sensor = hystory_forecast_solar_sensor
  65        self._inverter_to_acout_sensor = inverter_to_acout_sensor
  66
  67        
  68        # Photovoltaic installation values
  69        self._battery_capacity_Wh = battery_capacity_Wh
  70        self._max_charge_energy_per_period_Wh = max_charge_energy_per_period_Wh
  71        self._max_discharge_energy_per_period_Wh = max_discharge_energy_per_period_Wh
  72        self._max_buy_energy_per_period_Wh = max_buy_energy_per_period_Wh
  73        self._charge_efficiency = charge_efficiency
  74        self._discharge_efficiency = discharge_efficiency
  75        self.battery_purchase_price = battery_purchase_price
  76
  77        # Define internal class values that are calculated        
  78        self._data_source = "TFG EMG"
  79
  80        # Electricity prices
  81        self._dict_pvpc_buy_prices = None
  82        self._dict_pvpc_sell_prices = None
  83        self.sell_allowed = sell_allowed
  84
  85        # Solar production forecasts
  86        self._dict_forecast_solar = None
  87        self._dict_forecast_solar_last_update = None
  88        self.dict_effective_forecast_solar = None
  89        self._dict_effective_forecast_solar_last_update = None
  90
  91        # Historical data of total consumption and solar production obtained from InfluxDB
  92        self.influx_last_update = None
  93        self.df_history_solar_production = pd.DataFrame() # return an empty DataFrame
  94        self.history_solar_production_last_day_Wh = None
  95
  96        # Historical data of solar production forecasts made by Forecast.Solar
  97        self.df_hystory_forecast_solar = pd.DataFrame() # return an empty DataFrame 
  98        self.hystory_forecast_solar_last_day_Wh = None
  99        self.fore_to_real_df = pd.DataFrame() # return an empty DataFrame
 100        self.fore_to_real_dict = None
 101        self.enable_fore_to_real_correction = enable_fore_to_real_correction
 102
 103        self.last_history_solar_production_update = None  
 104
 105        # Consumption and solar production forecasts from Prophet
 106        self._prophet_last_update = None
 107        self.dict_demand_prophet_predictions = None
 108        self.demand_prophet_current_hour_prediction = None
 109        self.demand_prophet_next_hour_prediction = None

 114        self._test_min_soc_Wh = None

 131    async def async_close(self):
 132        """Close the aiohttp session."""
 133        await self._session.close()

 135    async def set_class_local_timezone(self, str_timezone):
 136        """Set the local timezone for the class."""
 137        if str_timezone is None:
 138            str_timezone = "Europe/Madrid"
 139        self.class_local_timezone = await asyncio.to_thread(pytz.timezone, str_timezone)

 142    async def set_dict_pvpc_buy_prices(self, dict_pvpc_buy_prices: dict[str, float]) -> None:
 143        """Set dict_pvpc_buy_prices."""
 144        if dict_pvpc_buy_prices != self._dict_pvpc_buy_prices:
 145            self._dict_pvpc_buy_prices = dict_pvpc_buy_prices

 155            self._dict_forecast_solar = dict_forecast_solar
 156            self._dict_forecast_solar_last_update = datetime.now()

 158    # Create set method for self._current_initial_soc_Wh

 160        """Set current_initial_soc_Wh."""

 163        else:
 164            self._current_initial_soc_Wh = None

 172            self._current_min_soc_Wh = None

 174    async def format_date_for_influxdb(self, date) -> str:
 175        """
 176        Return a date and time with timezone information in the format '2024-10-01T00:00:00Z' (UTC timezone).
 177        """
 178        date = pd.to_datetime(date)
 179        # Check if date has a localized time
 180        if date.tzinfo is None:
 181            if self.class_local_timezone is None:
 182                date_tz = 'Europe/Madrid'        
 183                # date = date.tz_localize(date_tz)
 184                date = await asyncio.to_thread(date.tz_localize, date_tz)
 185            else:
 186                # date = date.tz_localize(self.class_local_timezone)
 187                date = await asyncio.to_thread(date.tz_localize, self.class_local_timezone)
 188        # Localize the date and time to the UTC timezone
 189        date = await asyncio.to_thread(date.tz_convert, 'UTC')
 190        # Format the date in ISO 8601 format
 191        date = date.strftime('%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ')
 192        return date
 193
 194    async def energy_query_string(self, entity_id, start: str | None = None, end: str | None = None) -> str:
 195        """Create the SQL query string for energy data."""
 196        if start is not None:
 197            start = await self.format_date_for_influxdb(start)
 198        if end is not None:
 199            end = await self.format_date_for_influxdb(end)
 200        # If start and end are not specified, return all data
 201        if start is None and end is None:
 202            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(entity_id)
 203        elif start is None:
 204            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE (time <= '{}') AND "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(end, entity_id) 
 205        elif end is None:
 206            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE (time >= '{}') AND "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(start, entity_id)   
 207        else:
 208            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE (time >= '{}') AND (time <= '{}') AND "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(start, end, entity_id)
 209        return query                         
 210
 211    async def df_from_influxdb(self, query: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
 212        """
 213        Function to read data from InfluxDB using the InfluxDB API with aiohttp.
 214        """
 215        try:
 216            #_LOGGER.debug("Starting df_from_influxdb")
 217            params = {
 218                'db': self._influx_db_database,
 219                'q': query
 220            }
 221            auth = (self._influx_db_user, self._influx_db_pass)
 222            async with self._session.get(self._influx_db_url, params=params, auth=aiohttp.BasicAuth(auth[0], auth[1])) as response:
 223                if response.status != 200:
 224                    response.raise_for_status()
 225                data = await response.json()
 226            if 'results' not in data or not data['results'] or 'series' not in data['results'][0] or not data['results'][0]['series']:
 227                raise ValueError("No data returned from InfluxDB")                    
 228            
 229            #_LOGGER.debug("Data available. Starting conversion to DataFrame")
 230            data = data['results'][0]['series'][0]
 231            columns = data['columns']
 232            values = data['values']
 233            
 234            df = pd.DataFrame(values, columns=columns)
 235            # Convert the time column to the DataFrame index
 236            df['time'] = pd.to_datetime(df['time'])
 237            df.set_index('time', inplace=True)
 238            # InfluxDB returns dates in UTC, convert them to the local timezone and delocalize them
 239            # Perform the timezone conversion in a separate thread
 240            df.index = await asyncio.to_thread(df.index.tz_convert, self.class_local_timezone)
 241            # Delocalize the dates in a separate thread
 242            df.index = await asyncio.to_thread(df.index.tz_localize, None)
 243                     
 244            #_LOGGER.debug(f"Conversion to DataFrame completed, query: {query}")
 245            return df
 246        except Exception as e:
 247            _LOGGER.debug(f"Error fetching data from InfluxDB: {e}. Query={query}")
 248            return pd.DataFrame() # return an empty DataFrame
 249
 250    async def hourly_delta_energy_dataframe(self, entity_id, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 251        """Create a DataFrame with hourly energy deltas."""
 252        # Create the SQL query to get the energy data. NaN values are filled with the last known value
 253        query = await self.energy_query_string(entity_id, start, end)
 254
 255        # Create a DataFrame with the energy data obtained from InfluxDB
 256        df = await self.df_from_influxdb(query)
 257
 258        # If no data was obtained, return an empty DataFrame
 259        # Even if the connection is successful and the query is correct, if there is no data in the specified range
 260        # an empty DataFrame is returned
 261        if df is None or df.empty:
 262            return pd.DataFrame()
 263        
 264        # Handle NaN values that may appear as a result of 
 265        # a date range wider than the available data
 266        # first_index = df.iloc[:, 1].first_valid_index() # first index where the value is not NaN
 267        # first_value = df.iloc[first_index, 1]
 268        # mask = df.index < first_index # records before the first non-NaN value
 269        # df.loc[mask, df.columns[1]] = first_value  # Fill NaN values with first_value
 270        first_index = df['energy_kWh'].first_valid_index() # first index where the value is not NaN
 271        first_value = df.loc[first_index, 'energy_kWh'] # first value that is not NaN
 272        mask = df.index < first_index # records before the first non-NaN value
 273        df.loc[mask, 'energy_kWh'] = first_value # Fill NaN values with first_value
 274
 275        # Create a new column that calculates the hourly energy difference
 276        # df['delta_energy'] = df.iloc[:, 1].diff()
 277        df['delta_energy'] = df['energy_kWh'].diff()
 278
 279        # Remove the first row of the DataFrame (the hourly difference of the first record does not make sense)
 280        #df = df.iloc[1:]
 281        df = df.dropna()
 282
 283        # If there has been any counter reset, the difference will be negative
 284        mask = df['delta_energy'] < 0
 285        df.loc[mask, 'delta_energy'] = 0 # In those cases, set the difference to 0
 286
 287        return df
 288
 289
 290    async def hourly_energy_dataframe(self, entity_id, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 291        """Create a DataFrame with hourly energy data."""
 292        # Create the SQL query to get the energy data. NaN values are filled with the last known value
 293        query = await self.energy_query_string(entity_id, start, end)
 294
 295        # Create a DataFrame with the energy data obtained from InfluxDB
 296        df = await self.df_from_influxdb(query)
 297
 298        # If no data was obtained, return an empty DataFrame
 299        if df is None or df.empty:
 300            return pd.DataFrame()  
 301        
 302        # Rename the column energy_kWh to delta_energy
 303        df.rename(columns={'energy_kWh': 'delta_energy'}, inplace=True)
 304
 305        # Handle NaN values that may appear as a result of 
 306        # a date range wider than the available data
 307        df.fillna(0, inplace=True)  # Fill NaN values with 0
 308
 309        return df
 310    
 311    async def energy_total_in_df_by_date(self, df, selected_date) -> float:
 312        """Return the total energy consumed in a DataFrame for a selected date."""
 313        if df is None or df.empty:
 314            return 0.0
 315        
 316        # Create the start and end date for the selection
 317        start = selected_date.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 318        end = selected_date.replace(hour=23, minute=59, second=59, microsecond=0)
 319        
 320        # Select the energy data for the selected date
 321        df = df[start:end]
 322        
 323        # If no data was obtained, return 0.0
 324        if df is None or df.empty:
 325            return 0.0
 326        else:
 327            return df['delta_energy'].sum() 
 328

 330    async def get_history_solar_production_df(self, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 331        """Get the historical solar production DataFrame."""
 332        # Get the name for the query from self._solar_production_sensor
 333        entity_id = self._solar_production_sensor.split('.')[1]
 334        df_solar_production = await self.hourly_delta_energy_dataframe(entity_id, start=start, end=end)
 335        
 336        if df_solar_production.empty:
 337            # If no data was obtained, generate a DataFrame with 0 values
 338            end_datetime = datetime.now() if end is None else pd.to_datetime(end)
 339            start_datetime = end_datetime - timedelta(days=HISTORY_SOLAR_MAX_DAYS) if start is None else pd.to_datetime(start)
 340            
 341            # Create a DataFrame with 0 values                
 342            df_solar_production = await self.make_hourly_df_between_dates(start_datetime, end_datetime, 0.0)
 343            df_solar_production.rename(columns={'value': 'delta_energy'}, inplace=True)
 344            
 345            return df_solar_production
 346        
 347        return pd.DataFrame(df_solar_production, columns=['delta_energy']) 
 348
 349    async def get_history_forecast_solar_df(self, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 350        """Get the historical solar forecast DataFrame."""
 351        # Get the name for the query from self._hystory_forecast_solar_sensor
 352        entity_id = self._hystory_forecast_solar_sensor.split('.')[1]
 353        df_forecast_solar = await self.hourly_energy_dataframe(entity_id, start=start, end=end)
 354        
 355        if df_forecast_solar.empty: 
 356            # If no data was obtained, generate a DataFrame with 0 values
 357            end_datetime = datetime.now() if end is None else pd.to_datetime(end)
 358            start_datetime = end_datetime - timedelta(days=HISTORY_SOLAR_MAX_DAYS) if start is None else pd.to_datetime(start)
 359            
 360            # Create a DataFrame with 0 values                
 361            df_forecast_solar = await self.make_hourly_df_between_dates(start_datetime, end_datetime, 0.0)
 362            df_forecast_solar.rename(columns={'value': 'delta_energy'}, inplace=True)
 363            
 364            return df_forecast_solar
 365        
 366        return pd.DataFrame(df_forecast_solar, columns=['delta_energy'])    
 367    
 368    async def update_influxdb(self, start=None, end=None, force_update: bool = False) -> bool:
 369        """Update InfluxDB data."""
 370        # Check if more than INFLUX_UPDATE_INTERVAL has passed since the last update
 371        if self.influx_last_update is not None \
 372            and (datetime.now() - self.influx_last_update < INFLUX_UPDATE_INTERVAL) \
 373            and not force_update:
 374            _LOGGER.debug("InfluxDB data is still valid") 
 375            return True
 376        
 377        _LOGGER.debug("InfluxDB data needs to be updated") 
 378        
 379        current_datetime = datetime.now()
 380        success=True # This check comes from the original code. It is not clear if it is necessary
 381        
 382        # Update historical solar production data only once a day
 383        if self.last_history_solar_production_update is None \
 384            or (current_datetime.date() - self.last_history_solar_production_update.date() > timedelta(days=1)): 
 385            previous_day = current_datetime - timedelta(days=1)
 386            solar_start = previous_day - timedelta(days=HISTORY_SOLAR_MAX_DAYS)
 387            
 388            # Update historical solar production data
 389            self.df_history_solar_production = await self.get_history_solar_production_df(start=solar_start, end=previous_day)
 390            
 391            # Update historical solar forecast data
 392            self.df_hystory_forecast_solar = await self.get_history_forecast_solar_df(start=solar_start, end=previous_day)
 393            
 394            # Get the solar production of the last day
 395            self.history_solar_production_last_day_Wh = await self.energy_total_in_df_by_date(self.df_history_solar_production, previous_day)
 396            self.history_solar_production_last_day_Wh *= 1000  # Convert from kWh to Wh
 397            
 398            # Get the solar forecast of the last day
 399            self.hystory_forecast_solar_last_day_Wh = await self.energy_total_in_df_by_date(self.df_hystory_forecast_solar, previous_day)
 400            self.hystory_forecast_solar_last_day_Wh *= 1000  # Convert from kWh to Wh
 401            
 402            await self.compare_solar_production_forecast()
 403            self.last_history_solar_production_update = current_datetime
 404
 405            success = len(self.df_history_solar_production) > 0 and len(self.df_hystory_forecast_solar) > 0
 406
 407        if success:
 408            self.influx_last_update = datetime.now()
 409            _LOGGER.debug("Solar production data updated at {} from InfluxDB".format(self.influx_last_update))
 410            _LOGGER.debug(f"history_solar_production_last_day Wh: {self.history_solar_production_last_day_Wh}")
 411            _LOGGER.debug(f"hystory_forecast_solar_last_day Wh: {self.hystory_forecast_solar_last_day_Wh}")
 412
 413            return True            
 414        else:
 415            _LOGGER.debug("Failed to obtain data from InfluxDB")
 416            return False

 451    #         # Return the minSoC value
 452    #         return df['minsoc'].iloc[0]
 453
 454    async def post_energy_query(self, base_url, energy_query_data):
 455        try:
 456            async with self._session.post(f"{base_url}/energy_queries", json=energy_query_data) as response:
 457                if response.status != 200:
 458                    response.raise_for_status()
 459                data = await response.json()
 460            # Check if data is empty
 461            if not data:
 462                raise ValueError("No data returned from Addon API")
 463            return data              
 464
 465        except Exception as e:
 466            _LOGGER.error(f"Error posting energy query: {e}")
 467            return None
 468        
 469        async with self._session as session:
 470            async with session.post(f"{base_url}/energy_queries", json=energy_query_data) as response:
 471                return await response.json()
 472        
 473    async def make_predictions(self, current_datetime: datetime, force_update: bool = False) -> bool:
 474        """Make energy consumption predictions using Prophet."""
 475        # If the InfluxDB update date is more recent than the Prophet update date, recalculate predictions
 476        if self._prophet_last_update is not None \
 477            and self.influx_last_update is not None \
 478            and self._prophet_last_update > self.influx_last_update \
 479            and not force_update:
 480            _LOGGER.debug("Prophet data is still valid") 
 481            return True
 482        
 483
 484        _LOGGER.debug("Prophet data needs to be updated")
 485        # Show the start time of the prediction process
 486        _LOGGER.debug(f"Prophet predictions started at {datetime.now()}")     
 487
 488        try:
 489
 490            # Create current_date from current_datetime without minutes and seconds
 491            current_date = current_datetime.replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 492
 493            # Get the name for the query from self._acin_to_acout_sensor
 494            entity_id = self._acin_to_acout_sensor.split('.')[1]
 495            str_query1 = await self.energy_query_string(entity_id, start=None, end=current_date)
 496            
 497            # Get the name for the query from self._inverter_to_acout_sensor
 498            entity_id = self._inverter_to_acout_sensor.split('.')[1]
 499            str_query2 = await self.energy_query_string(entity_id, start=None, end=current_date) 
 500
 501            energy_query_data = {
 502                "str_query1": str_query1,
 503                "str_query2": str_query2,
 504                "futurePeriods": 30,
 505                "futureFreq": "h"
 506            }
 507            # base_url = "http://192.168.0.100:5000" # Raspeberry Pi (HA OS) runs the container with the API
 508            # base_url = "http://localhost:5000" # Raspeberry Pi (HA OS) runs the container with the API
 509            base_url = self._prophet_influxdb_addon_url
 510            _LOGGER.info(f"base url for addon: {base_url}")            
 511
 512            response = await self.post_energy_query(base_url, energy_query_data)
 513            if response is None:
 514                raise ValueError("No data returned from Addon API") 
 515                
 516            _LOGGER.debug("Energy Queries response:", response)
 517            cc_response = {str(k): v for k, v in response.items()}
 518            # Convert the dates to the local timezone
 519            # Convert predictions to integers and Wh
 520            cc_response = {pd.to_datetime(k).tz_convert(self.class_local_timezone)\
 521                            .strftime('%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S'): int(v * 1000) \
 522                            for k, v in cc_response.items()}
 523            _LOGGER.debug(f"\nEnergy Queries response local timezone: {cc_response}")
 524
 525            # Store values locally
 526            self.dict_demand_prophet_predictions = cc_response        
 527
 528            # Store the prediction for this hour and the next hour
 529            # Note: the current hour is index 0. The next hour is index 1
 530            self.demand_prophet_current_hour_prediction = cc_response[list(cc_response.keys())[0]]
 531            self.demand_prophet_next_hour_prediction = cc_response[list(cc_response.keys())[1]]          
 532
 533            # Update the last Prophet update date
 534            self._prophet_last_update = datetime.now()
 535
 536            # Show the end time of the prediction process
 537            _LOGGER.debug(f"Prophet demand predictions finished at {datetime.now()}")
 538
 539            return True
 540        except Exception as e:
 541            _LOGGER.error(f"Error making demand predictions with Prophet: {e}")
 542            return False
 543
 544
 545    def need_new_target_socs(self):
 546        """Check if new target SoCs need to be calculated."""
 547        # Check if there is a significant deviation in the target SoCs values
 548        if self._last_calc_initial_soc_Wh is not None and self._current_initial_soc_Wh is not None:
 549            soc_deviation = 100 * abs(self._last_calc_initial_soc_Wh - self._current_initial_soc_Wh) / self._battery_capacity_Wh
 550            if soc_deviation > SOC_PERCENT_DEVIATION_FORCE_RECALC:
 551                _LOGGER.info("Target SoCs need to be recalculated due to SoC deviation of previous calcs: {:.2f}%".format(soc_deviation)) 
 552                return True
 553
 554        # Check if more than TARGET_SOC_UPDATE_INTERVAL hours have passed since the last target SoCs update
 555        if self._target_socs_last_update is None:
 556            _LOGGER.debug("Target SoCs need to be updated")
 557            return True
 558        else:
 559            if datetime.now() - self._target_socs_last_update >= TARGET_SOC_UPDATE_INTERVAL:
 560                _LOGGER.debug("Target SoCs need to be updated")
 561                return True
 562            else:
 563                _LOGGER.debug("Target SoCs are still valid") 
 564                return False
 565
 566    def check_data_ready(self):
 567        """Check if all necessary data is available."""
 568        # Check if electricity price data is available
 569        if self._dict_pvpc_buy_prices is None or self._dict_pvpc_sell_prices is None:
 570            _LOGGER.debug("No electricity price data available")
 571            return False
 572
 573        # Check if solar forecast data is available
 574        if self._dict_forecast_solar is None:
 575            _LOGGER.debug("No solar forecast data available")
 576            return False
 577        
 578        # Check if corrected solar forecast data is available
 579        if self.dict_effective_forecast_solar is None:
 580            _LOGGER.debug("No effective solar forecast data available")
 581            return False       
 582        
 583        # Check if we have a value for the current SoC
 584        if self._current_initial_soc_Wh is None:
 585            _LOGGER.debug("No SoC data available")
 586            return False
 587
 588        # Check if photovoltaic installation data is available
 589        if self._battery_capacity_Wh is None or self._max_charge_energy_per_period_Wh is None \
 590            or self._max_discharge_energy_per_period_Wh is None or self._max_buy_energy_per_period_Wh is None \
 591            or self._charge_efficiency is None or self._discharge_efficiency is None \
 592            or self._current_min_soc_Wh is None or self._current_initial_soc_Wh is None:
 593            _LOGGER.debug("Some photovoltaic installation data is missing")
 594            return False
 595
 596        return True
 597
 598    async def prepare_lists_for_soc_calc(self, current_datetime: datetime) -> bool:
 599        """Prepare lists for SoC calculation."""
 600        # Set the calculation moment
 601        # current_datetime = datetime.now()
 602
 603        # Create lists of electricity prices and solar forecast
 604        if self._dict_pvpc_buy_prices is not None:
 605            buy_prices = await self.pvpc_dict_to_list(self._dict_pvpc_buy_prices, current_datetime)
 606        else:
 607            _LOGGER.debug("No electricity buy price data available")
 608            return False
 609        
 610        if self._dict_pvpc_sell_prices is not None:
 611            sell_prices = await self.pvpc_dict_to_list(self._dict_pvpc_sell_prices, current_datetime)
 612            if self.sell_allowed is False:
 613                sell_prices = [0.0] * len(sell_prices)
 614        else:
 615            _LOGGER.debug("No electricity sell price data available")
 616            return False
 617        
 618        if self.dict_effective_forecast_solar is not None:
 619            forecast_solar = await self.forecast_solar_dict_to_list(self.dict_effective_forecast_solar, current_datetime)
 620        else:
 621            _LOGGER.debug("No solar forecast data available")
 622            return False               
 623        
 624        if self.dict_demand_prophet_predictions is None:
 625            _LOGGER.debug("No electricity consumption data available")
 626            return False
 627
 628        # Create the list with Prophet consumption forecasts
 629        current_date = current_datetime.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 630        demand_dict = self.dict_demand_prophet_predictions
 631        demand_dict = {k: v for k, v in demand_dict.items() if datetime.fromisoformat(k) >= current_date}
 632        demand = list(demand_dict.values())
 633
 634        max_i_buy = len(buy_prices)
 635        max_i_sell = len(sell_prices)
 636        max_i_solar = len(forecast_solar)
 637        max_i_demand = len(demand)
 638        # Log the lengths of the lists
 639        _LOGGER.debug(f"Length of buy prices list: {max_i_buy}")
 640        _LOGGER.debug(f"Length of sell prices list: {max_i_sell}")
 641        _LOGGER.debug(f"Length of solar production list: {max_i_solar}")
 642        _LOGGER.debug(f"Length of demand list: {max_i_demand}")
 643
 644        # Log the lists
 645        _LOGGER.debug(f"Buy prices list: {buy_prices}")
 646        _LOGGER.debug(f"Sell prices list: {sell_prices}")
 647        _LOGGER.debug(f"Solar production list: {forecast_solar}")
 648        _LOGGER.debug(f"Demand list: {demand}")
 649
 650        max_index = min(max_i_buy, max_i_sell, max_i_solar, max_i_demand)
 651        if max_index <= 1:
 652            _LOGGER.debug("Not enough data for SoC calculation")
 653            return False
 654
 655        _LOGGER.info(f"Optimization will be performed for {max_index} periods")   
 656
 657        self._list_buy_prices = buy_prices[0:max_index]
 658        self._list_sell_prices = sell_prices[0:max_index]
 659        self._list_solar_production = forecast_solar[0:max_index]
 660        self._list_demand = demand[0:max_index]
 661        return True        
 662
 663                                                
 664    async def pvpc_dict_to_list(self, dict_pvpc: dict[str, float], current_datetime: datetime) -> list[float]:
 665        """Convert an electricity price dictionary into a list of floats."""
 666        # The electricity price dictionary must be formatted by the coordinator to make it continuous
 667        # using the utils.pvpc_raw_to_useful_dict function
 668        # it has date_hours as keys in str format, e.g., '2024-10-28 07:00:00'        
 669
 670        # If the dictionary is empty, return an empty list
 671        if not dict_pvpc:
 672            return []
 673
 674        # Get a datetime with the current date removing minutes and seconds
 675        current_date = current_datetime.replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0) 
 676
 677        df = pd.DataFrame(dict_pvpc.items(), columns=['date', 'value'])
 678
 679        df['date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date'])
 680        df = df.set_index('date')
 681
 682        # Remove values earlier than current_date
 683        df = df[df.index >= current_date]
 684        # If df is empty, return an empty list
 685        if df.empty:
 686            return []
 687        
 688        return df['value'].tolist()  
 689     
 690
 691    async def forecast_solar_dict_to_list(self, dict_forecast_solar: dict[str, float], current_datetime: datetime) -> list[float]:
 692        """Convert a solar forecast dictionary into a list of floats."""
 693        # The solar forecast dictionary must be formatted by the coordinator to make it continuous
 694        # using the utils.get_forecast_solar_dict function
 695        # it has date_hours as keys in str format, e.g., '2024-10-28 07:00:00'
 696
 697        # If the dictionary is empty, return an empty list
 698        if not dict_forecast_solar:
 699            return []
 700        
 701        # Get a datetime with the current date removing minutes and seconds
 702        current_date = current_datetime.replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0) 
 703
 704        df = pd.DataFrame(dict_forecast_solar.items(), columns=['date', 'value'])
 705
 706        df['date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date'])
 707        df = df.set_index('date')
 708
 709        # Remove values earlier than current_date
 710        df = df[df.index >= current_date]
 711        # If df is empty, return an empty list
 712        if df.empty:
 713            return []
 714        
 715        return df['value'].tolist()

 717    
 718    async def make_target_socs(self, current_datetime: datetime, force_update: bool = False) -> bool:
 719        """
 720        Calculate the target SoCs for as many periods as we have available information.
 721        """
 722        # Check if the necessary data is available
 723        if not self.check_data_ready():
 724            return False
 725
 726        # Check if it is necessary to recalculate the target SoCs
 727        if not self.need_new_target_socs() and not force_update:
 728            return True
 729
 730        _LOGGER.debug("Calculating target SoCs")
 731
 732        # Prepare the lists for SoC calculation
 733        if not await self.prepare_lists_for_soc_calc(current_datetime):
 734            _LOGGER.debug("Failed to load lists")
 735            return False
 736
 737        # Calculate the target SoCs
 738        _LOGGER.debug(f"Starting PuLP: {datetime.now()}")
 739        # Log the buy prices
 740        for i in range(len(self._list_buy_prices)-1):
 741            _LOGGER.debug(f"Price {i}:{self._list_buy_prices[i]} /kWh")
 742            if self._list_buy_prices[i] < self._list_buy_prices[i+1]:
 743                _LOGGER.debug(f"Price {i} is lower than {i+1}: {self._list_buy_prices[i]} < {self._list_buy_prices[i+1]}")
 744            else:
 745                _LOGGER.debug(f"Price {i} is greater than {i+1}: {self._list_buy_prices[i]} > {self._list_buy_prices[i+1]}")        
 746
 747        # We can iterate and test diferents min_soc values
 748        self._test_min_soc_Wh = self._current_min_soc_Wh
 749        result,objetive = await self.pulp_calculations(current_datetime)
 750
 751        soc = result['SoC(%)']
 752        soc_len = len(soc)
 753        current_date = current_datetime.replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 754        date_list = [(current_date + timedelta(hours=x)).isoformat() for x in range(soc_len)]
 755        self.dict_target_socs = dict(zip(date_list, soc))
 756
 757        self.target_soc_current_hour = result['SoC(%)'][0]
 758        _LOGGER.debug(f"Finishing PuLP: {datetime.now()} with result: {result} and objetive: {objetive}")
 759
 760        # When the target SoCs calculation starts, the value of current_initial_soc_Wh provided
 761        # by the coordinator is used to perform the calculation and is stored in _last_calc_initial_soc_Wh
 762        # to compare if it is necessary to recalculate the target SoCs when the difference between them is large
 763        # This check is performed in need_new_target_socs
 764 
 765        self._last_calc_initial_soc_Wh = self._current_initial_soc_Wh
 766        self._target_socs_last_update = datetime.now()
 767        return True
 768    
 769
 770    async def pulp_calculations(self,current_datetime: datetime) -> dict:
 771        """
 772        Solve the optimization problem with PuLP.
 773        """
 774        # Lists of demand, solar production, buy and sell prices
 775        demand = self._list_demand  # Demand in Wh per hour
 776        solar_production = self._list_solar_production  # Solar production in Wh per hour
 777        buy_prices = self._list_buy_prices  # Buy prices in /kWh
 778        sell_prices = self._list_sell_prices  # Sell prices in /kWh
 779
 780        # Read the current SoC
 781        initial_soc = self._current_initial_soc_Wh  # Initial state of charge of the battery (Wh)
 782
 783        # Use a test min_soc value for the optimization
 784        min_soc = self._test_min_soc_Wh # self._current_min_soc_Wh  # Minimum allowed SoC (Wh)
 785
 786        # Photovoltaic installation parameters
 787        battery_capacity = self._battery_capacity_Wh  # Maximum battery capacity (Wh)
 788        max_charge_energy_per_period = self._max_charge_energy_per_period_Wh  # (Wh), due to the maximum charging power max_charge_power(W)
 789        max_discharge_energy_per_period = self._max_discharge_energy_per_period_Wh  # (Wh), due to the maximum discharging power max_discharge_power(W)
 790        max_buy_energy_per_period = self._max_buy_energy_per_period_Wh  # (Wh), due to the maximum contracted power with the grid max_grid_power(W)
 791        charge_efficiency = self._charge_efficiency  # Battery charging efficiency (AC-DC conversion efficiency)
 792        discharge_efficiency = self._discharge_efficiency  # Battery discharging efficiency (DC-AC conversion efficiency)
 793
 794        # Take into account the time remaining until the end of the current hour
 795        max_charge_energy_first_period = max_charge_energy_per_period - (current_datetime.minute * max_charge_energy_per_period / 60)
 796        max_discharge_energy_first_period = max_discharge_energy_per_period - (current_datetime.minute * max_discharge_energy_per_period / 60)
 797        max_buy_energy_first_period = max_buy_energy_per_period - (current_datetime.minute * max_buy_energy_per_period / 60)
 798        demand[0] = demand[0] - (current_datetime.minute * demand[0] / 60)
 799        solar_production[0] = solar_production[0] - (current_datetime.minute * solar_production[0] / 60)
 800
 801        # Battery cost parameters
 802        battery_purchase_price = self.battery_purchase_price  # 1000 ?
 803        battery_eol_cycles_if_min_soc_20 = 2500  # cycles
 804        battery_eol_cycles_if_min_soc_50 = 5000  # cycles
 805        min_soc_percent= min_soc / battery_capacity *100 # %
 806        # Linear interpolation between 20% and 50% to estimate the battery lifetime at min_soc_percent
 807        battery_eol_cycles_current_min_soc = battery_eol_cycles_if_min_soc_20 + \
 808            (battery_eol_cycles_if_min_soc_50 - battery_eol_cycles_if_min_soc_20) * (min_soc_percent - 20) / 30  # cycles
 809
 810        # Battery energy cost. Only considered when discharging the battery
 811        # In its lifetime, the battery can provide:
 812        all_live_energy= (battery_eol_cycles_current_min_soc*battery_capacity*(100-min_soc_percent)/100)/1000 # kWh of energy
 813        # Therefore, the cost of the energy from battery is battery_purchase_price / all_live_energy /kWh
 814        battery_energy_price = battery_purchase_price / all_live_energy  # /kWh
 815
 816        # Number of hours to consider       
 817        num_hours = min(len(demand), len(solar_production), len(buy_prices), len(sell_prices))
 818
 819        # Sum of demand and solar production
 820        total_demand = sum(demand)
 821        total_solar_production = sum(solar_production)
 822        # Coste bruto de la demanda
 823        gross_demand_cost = sum([demand[i]*buy_prices[i] for i in range(num_hours)]) / 1000
 824        # Average electricity price
 825        average_price = sum(buy_prices) / num_hours
 826
 827        # Max electricity price
 828        max_price = max(buy_prices)
 829        # Min electricity price
 830        min_price = min(buy_prices)
 831        # get hour at min price
 832        min_price_hour = buy_prices.index(min_price)       
 833
 834        # Set the weight we will give in the objective function to maximize the final SoC versus minimizing the cost of purchased energy
 835        # When solar production is greater than demand, maximizing the SoC will be prioritized
 836        if total_solar_production >= total_demand:
 837            w = 2 * average_price / 1000
 838            # w = 2 * max_price / 1000
 839            _LOGGER.debug(f"Solar production covers all demand! w={w}")
 840        else:
 841            w = average_price / 1000
 842            # w = max_price / 1000
 843            _LOGGER.debug(f"Solar production does not cover all demand! w={w}")
 844
 845        # NOTE: THE PROBLEM IS SOLVED CORRECTLY EVEN IF initial_soc < min_soc
 846
 847        # Create the optimization problem
 848        problem = pulp.LpProblem("Optimal_SOC_with_Cost_Minimization", pulp.LpMinimize)
 849
 850        # Decision variables: energies and SoC of the battery at each hour
 851        energy_from_grid = [pulp.LpVariable(f'f_grid_{i}', lowBound=0, upBound=max_buy_energy_per_period) for i in range(num_hours)]
 852        energy_to_grid = [pulp.LpVariable(f't_grid_{i}', lowBound=0) for i in range(num_hours)]
 853        soc = [pulp.LpVariable(f'soc_{i}', lowBound=0, upBound=battery_capacity) for i in range(num_hours)]
 854        energy_to_battery = [pulp.LpVariable(f'charge_{i}', lowBound=0, upBound=max_charge_energy_per_period) for i in range(num_hours)]
 855        energy_from_battery = [pulp.LpVariable(f'discharge_{i}', lowBound=0, upBound=max_discharge_energy_per_period) for i in range(num_hours)]
 856
 857        # Objective function: minimize the cost of energy and maximize the SoC
 858        energy_cost = pulp.lpSum([(energy_from_grid[i] * buy_prices[i] + \
 859                                energy_from_battery[i] * battery_energy_price - \
 860                                energy_to_grid[i] * sell_prices[i] - \
 861                                energy_to_battery[i] * battery_energy_price \
 862                                )*(1/1000) \
 863                                for i in range(num_hours)])  # Convert prices to /Wh        
 864        final_soc = soc[-1]  # The state of charge in the last period
 865        problem += energy_cost - w * final_soc
 866
 867        # CONSTRAINTS
 868        # Require that the SoC at the last period is greater than the initial SoC.
 869        # The final SoC could have been set as an input parameter. Consider this in future versions
 870        problem += soc[-1] >= initial_soc
 871        for i in range(num_hours):
 872            if i == 0:
 873                # In the first hour, start from initial_soc and balance
 874                problem += soc[i] == initial_soc + energy_to_battery[i] - energy_from_battery[i]
 875                # Limit the energy that can enter the battery due to the maximum charging power in first period
 876                problem += energy_to_battery[i] <= max_charge_energy_first_period
 877                problem += energy_from_battery[i] <= max_discharge_energy_first_period
 878                problem += energy_from_grid[i] <= max_buy_energy_first_period
 879                # How much energy can be sent to the battery in the first period if the initial SoC is less than min_soc?
 880                max_energy_available = max(max_buy_energy_first_period + solar_production[0] - demand[0],0)
 881                max_energy_to_battery = min(max_charge_energy_first_period, max_energy_available*charge_efficiency)
 882                # Try to recover the SoC as quickly as possible if it is below min_soc
 883                if initial_soc < min_soc:
 884                    problem += soc[i] >= initial_soc + max_energy_to_battery
 885                else:
 886                    # Require that the SoC does not fall below the minimum allowed
 887                    problem += soc[i] >= min_soc      
 888            else:
 889                # In the following hours, the SoC depends on the previous state
 890                problem += soc[i] == soc[i - 1] + energy_to_battery[i] - energy_from_battery[i]
 891                # Require that the SoC does not fall below the minimum allowed
 892                problem += soc[i] >= min_soc        
 893
 894            # Global energy balance
 895            problem += demand[i] + pulp.lpSum(energy_to_battery[i])/charge_efficiency + energy_to_grid[i] == \
 896                energy_from_grid[i] + solar_production[i] + pulp.lpSum(energy_from_battery[i]) * discharge_efficiency                  
 897        try:
 898            # Run problem.solve() in a separate thread
 899            await asyncio.to_thread(problem.solve)
 900        except pulp.PulpSolverError as e:
 901            _LOGGER.error(f"Error running the PuLP solver: {e}")
 902            # raise UpdateFailed(f"Error running the PuLP solver: {e}")
 903            return None, None
 904
 905        # Check the solution status
 906        status = pulp.LpStatus[problem.status]
 907        _LOGGER.info(f"PuLP solution status: {status}")
 908
 909        if status != 'Optimal':
 910            return None, None
 911
 912        _LOGGER.info(f"Objective function: {pulp.value(problem.objective):.2f} ")
 913
 914        # Results
 915        total_grid_cost = 0
 916        for i in range(num_hours):
 917            total_grid_cost += energy_from_grid[i].varValue * buy_prices[i] \
 918                                - energy_to_grid[i].varValue * sell_prices[i]
 919        total_grid_cost = total_grid_cost / 1000  # Convert to  (price is in /kWh and energy in Wh)
 920        total_battery_cost = 0
 921        for i in range(num_hours):
 922            total_battery_cost += energy_from_battery[i].varValue * battery_energy_price \
 923                                - energy_to_battery[i].varValue * battery_energy_price
 924        total_battery_cost = total_battery_cost / 1000  # Convert to  (price is in /kWh and energy in Wh)
 925
 926        # Create a dictionary with the results
 927        current_date = current_datetime.replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 928        results = {
 929            "Hour": [i for i in range(1, num_hours + 1)],
 930            "System Time": [(current_date + timedelta(hours=i)).strftime("%H:%M") for i in range(num_hours)],
 931            "buy_price(/kWh)": buy_prices,
 932            "sell_price(/kWh)": sell_prices,
 933            "Demand(Wh)": [round(demand[i]) for i in range(num_hours)], 
 934            "from_solar(Wh)": [round(solar_production[i]) for i in range(num_hours)],
 935            "from_grid(Wh)": [round(energy_from_grid[i].varValue) for i in range(num_hours)],
 936            "to_grid(Wh)": [round(energy_to_grid[i].varValue) for i in range(num_hours)],
 937            "to_battery(Wh)": [round(energy_to_battery[i].varValue) for i in range(num_hours)],
 938            "from_battery(Wh)": [round(energy_from_battery[i].varValue) for i in range(num_hours)],
 939            "SoC(Wh)": [round(soc[i].varValue) for i in range(num_hours)],
 940            "SoC(%)": [round(soc[i].varValue / battery_capacity * 100) for i in range(num_hours)]
 941        }
 942        results['System Time'][0] = current_datetime.strftime("%H:%M")
 943        self.pulp_json_results = results
 944
 945        # Log the results
 946        _LOGGER.info(f"Results: {results}")
 947
 948        # Make a dictionary with other optimization data for the frontend
 949        self.pulp_parameters = {"Status": pulp.LpStatus[problem.status],
 950                                "Objective function": pulp.value(problem.objective),
 951                                "w": w,
 952                                "gross_demand_cost": gross_demand_cost,
 953                                "total_grid_cost": total_grid_cost,
 954                                "total_battery_cost": total_battery_cost,
 955                                "total_cost": total_grid_cost + total_battery_cost,
 956                                "total_demand": total_demand,
 957                                "total_solar_production": total_solar_production,
 958                                "average_price": average_price,
 959                                "max_price": max_price,
 960                                "min_price": min_price,
 961                                "min_price_hour": min_price_hour+1,
 962                                "battery_energy_price /kWh": battery_energy_price, # /kWh
 963                                "initial_soc": initial_soc, 
 964                                "min_soc": min_soc, 
 965                                "demand": self._list_demand, 
 966                                "solar_production": self._list_solar_production, 
 967                                "buy_prices": buy_prices, 
 968                                "sell_prices": sell_prices
 969                                }
 970
 971
 972        return results, pulp.value(problem.objective)
 973        
 974    async def make_hourly_df_between_dates(self, start, end, value) -> pd.DataFrame:
 975        """
 976        Create a DataFrame with hourly values between two dates.
 977        """
 978        # Convert start and end to datetime objects
 979        start = pd.to_datetime(start).replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 980        end = pd.to_datetime(end).replace(minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 981
 982        # Create a date range with hourly frequency between start and end
 983        date_range = pd.date_range(start=start, end=end, freq='H')
 984        # Create a DataFrame with the values and the date range
 985        df = pd.DataFrame(data=value, index=date_range, columns=['value'])
 986        df.index.name = 'time'
 987        return df

 989    async def compare_solar_production_forecast(self) -> bool:
 990        """
 991        Compare historical solar production with solar forecast.
 992        """
 993        # Check if the necessary data is available
 994        if self.df_history_solar_production is None or self.df_hystory_forecast_solar is None:
 995            return False
 996
 997        # Create a DataFrame with solar production grouped by hours with the mean of the data
 998        production_df = self.df_history_solar_production.copy()
 999        forecast_df = self.df_hystory_forecast_solar.copy()
1000        # Create a new field 'hour' extracting the hour from the DataFrame index
1001        production_df['hour'] = production_df.index.hour
1002        forecast_df['hour'] = forecast_df.index.hour
1003
1004        # Calculate the mean for each hour of the day
1005        production_df = production_df.groupby('hour')['delta_energy'].mean().reset_index()
1006        forecast_df = forecast_df.groupby('hour')['delta_energy'].mean().reset_index()
1007
1008        # Set 'hour' as the index
1009        production_df.set_index('hour', inplace=True)
1010        forecast_df.set_index('hour', inplace=True)
1011
1012        # Create a DataFrame with solar production and solar forecast
1013        df = pd.concat([production_df, forecast_df], axis=1)
1014        df.columns = ['real_energy', 'forecast_energy']
1015        df.dropna(inplace=True)
1016
1017        # Add the column 'fore_to_real' to df initialized to 1.0
1018        df['fore_to_real'] = 1.0
1019
1020        # Create a mask for the values of forecast_energy that are != 0
1021        mask = df['forecast_energy'] != 0
1022        # Calculate the ratio between forecast_energy and real_energy
1023        df.loc[mask, 'fore_to_real'] = df['real_energy'] / df['forecast_energy']
1024
1025        # Limit abnormally high values
1026        mask = df['fore_to_real'] > 2.0  
1027        df.loc[mask, 'fore_to_real'] = 2.0
1028        self.fore_to_real_df = df
1029        # Convert the columns real_energy and forecast_energy to Wh
1030        df['real_energy'] = round(df['real_energy'] * 1000, 0)
1031        # Rename the column to real_energy_Wh
1032        df.rename(columns={'real_energy': 'real_energy_Wh'}, inplace=True)
1033        df['forecast_energy'] = round(df['forecast_energy'] * 1000, 0)
1034        # Rename the column to forecast_energy_Wh
1035        df.rename(columns={'forecast_energy': 'forecast_energy_Wh'}, inplace=True)
1036        self.fore_to_real_dict = df.to_dict(orient='index')
1037        # Log the DataFrame
1038        _LOGGER.debug(f"Comparison of solar production and solar forecast for the last {HISTORY_SOLAR_MAX_DAYS} days: {df}")
1039        return True
1040    
1041    async def make_effective_forecast_solar(self):
1042        """
1043        Calculate the corrected solar forecast with the ratio between solar production and solar forecast.
1044        """
1045        # Check if it is necessary to update the corrected solar forecast
1046        if self._dict_effective_forecast_solar_last_update is not None \
1047            and self.last_history_solar_production_update is not None \
1048            and self._dict_forecast_solar_last_update is not None:
1049            most_recent_update = max(self.last_history_solar_production_update, self._dict_forecast_solar_last_update)
1050            if most_recent_update < self._dict_effective_forecast_solar_last_update:
1051                _LOGGER.debug("The corrected solar forecast is still valid")
1052                return True
1053
1054        if (self._dict_forecast_solar is not None) and (not self.enable_fore_to_real_correction):
1055            self.dict_effective_forecast_solar = self._dict_forecast_solar
1056            self._dict_effective_forecast_solar_last_update = datetime.now()
1057            return True
1058
1059        # Check if the necessary data is available
1060        if self._dict_forecast_solar is None or self.fore_to_real_df is None:
1061            return False
1062        try:
1063            # Create a dictionary with the corrected solar forecast
1064            dict_effective_forecast_solar = self._dict_forecast_solar.copy()
1065            for key, value in dict_effective_forecast_solar.items():
1066                # Get the hour of the day
1067                hour = pd.to_datetime(key).hour
1068                # Get the fore_to_real value for the corresponding hour
1069                fore_to_real = self.fore_to_real_df.loc[hour, 'fore_to_real']
1070                # Correct the solar forecast value
1071                dict_effective_forecast_solar[key] = value * fore_to_real
1072
1073            self._dict_effective_forecast_solar_last_update = datetime.now()
1074            self.dict_effective_forecast_solar = dict_effective_forecast_solar
1075            # Log the dictionary
1076            _LOGGER.debug(f"Corrected solar forecast: {dict_effective_forecast_solar}")
1077            return True
1078        except Exception as e:
1079            _LOGGER.error(f"Error calculating the corrected solar forecast: {e}")
1080            return False

 136    async def set_class_local_timezone(self, str_timezone):
 137        """Set the local timezone for the class."""
 138        if str_timezone is None:
 139            str_timezone = "Europe/Madrid"
 140        self.class_local_timezone = await asyncio.to_thread(pytz.timezone, str_timezone)

 175    async def format_date_for_influxdb(self, date) -> str:
 176        """
 177        Return a date and time with timezone information in the format '2024-10-01T00:00:00Z' (UTC timezone).
 178        """
 179        date = pd.to_datetime(date)
 180        # Check if date has a localized time
 181        if date.tzinfo is None:
 182            if self.class_local_timezone is None:
 183                date_tz = 'Europe/Madrid'        
 184                # date = date.tz_localize(date_tz)
 185                date = await asyncio.to_thread(date.tz_localize, date_tz)
 186            else:
 187                # date = date.tz_localize(self.class_local_timezone)
 188                date = await asyncio.to_thread(date.tz_localize, self.class_local_timezone)
 189        # Localize the date and time to the UTC timezone
 190        date = await asyncio.to_thread(date.tz_convert, 'UTC')
 191        # Format the date in ISO 8601 format
 192        date = date.strftime('%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ')
 193        return date
 194
 195    async def energy_query_string(self, entity_id, start: str | None = None, end: str | None = None) -> str:
 196        """Create the SQL query string for energy data."""
 197        if start is not None:
 198            start = await self.format_date_for_influxdb(start)
 199        if end is not None:
 200            end = await self.format_date_for_influxdb(end)
 201        # If start and end are not specified, return all data
 202        if start is None and end is None:
 203            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(entity_id)
 204        elif start is None:
 205            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE (time <= '{}') AND "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(end, entity_id) 
 206        elif end is None:
 207            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE (time >= '{}') AND "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(start, entity_id)   
 208        else:
 209            query = """SELECT last("value") AS "energy_kWh" FROM "kWh" WHERE (time >= '{}') AND (time <= '{}') AND "entity_id"='{}' GROUP BY time(1h) fill(previous)""".format(start, end, entity_id)
 210        return query                         
 211
 212    async def df_from_influxdb(self, query: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
 213        """
 214        Function to read data from InfluxDB using the InfluxDB API with aiohttp.
 215        """
 216        try:
 217            #_LOGGER.debug("Starting df_from_influxdb")
 218            params = {
 219                'db': self._influx_db_database,
 220                'q': query
 221            }
 222            auth = (self._influx_db_user, self._influx_db_pass)
 223            async with self._session.get(self._influx_db_url, params=params, auth=aiohttp.BasicAuth(auth[0], auth[1])) as response:
 224                if response.status != 200:
 225                    response.raise_for_status()
 226                data = await response.json()
 227            if 'results' not in data or not data['results'] or 'series' not in data['results'][0] or not data['results'][0]['series']:
 228                raise ValueError("No data returned from InfluxDB")                    
 229            
 230            #_LOGGER.debug("Data available. Starting conversion to DataFrame")
 231            data = data['results'][0]['series'][0]
 232            columns = data['columns']
 233            values = data['values']
 234            
 235            df = pd.DataFrame(values, columns=columns)
 236            # Convert the time column to the DataFrame index
 237            df['time'] = pd.to_datetime(df['time'])
 238            df.set_index('time', inplace=True)
 239            # InfluxDB returns dates in UTC, convert them to the local timezone and delocalize them
 240            # Perform the timezone conversion in a separate thread
 241            df.index = await asyncio.to_thread(df.index.tz_convert, self.class_local_timezone)
 242            # Delocalize the dates in a separate thread
 243            df.index = await asyncio.to_thread(df.index.tz_localize, None)
 244                     
 245            #_LOGGER.debug(f"Conversion to DataFrame completed, query: {query}")
 246            return df
 247        except Exception as e:
 248            _LOGGER.debug(f"Error fetching data from InfluxDB: {e}. Query={query}")
 249            return pd.DataFrame() # return an empty DataFrame
 250
 251    async def hourly_delta_energy_dataframe(self, entity_id, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 252        """Create a DataFrame with hourly energy deltas."""
 253        # Create the SQL query to get the energy data. NaN values are filled with the last known value
 254        query = await self.energy_query_string(entity_id, start, end)
 255
 256        # Create a DataFrame with the energy data obtained from InfluxDB
 257        df = await self.df_from_influxdb(query)
 258
 259        # If no data was obtained, return an empty DataFrame
 260        # Even if the connection is successful and the query is correct, if there is no data in the specified range
 261        # an empty DataFrame is returned
 262        if df is None or df.empty:
 263            return pd.DataFrame()
 264        
 265        # Handle NaN values that may appear as a result of 
 266        # a date range wider than the available data
 267        # first_index = df.iloc[:, 1].first_valid_index() # first index where the value is not NaN
 268        # first_value = df.iloc[first_index, 1]
 269        # mask = df.index < first_index # records before the first non-NaN value
 270        # df.loc[mask, df.columns[1]] = first_value  # Fill NaN values with first_value
 271        first_index = df['energy_kWh'].first_valid_index() # first index where the value is not NaN
 272        first_value = df.loc[first_index, 'energy_kWh'] # first value that is not NaN
 273        mask = df.index < first_index # records before the first non-NaN value
 274        df.loc[mask, 'energy_kWh'] = first_value # Fill NaN values with first_value
 275
 276        # Create a new column that calculates the hourly energy difference
 277        # df['delta_energy'] = df.iloc[:, 1].diff()
 278        df['delta_energy'] = df['energy_kWh'].diff()
 279
 280        # Remove the first row of the DataFrame (the hourly difference of the first record does not make sense)
 281        #df = df.iloc[1:]
 282        df = df.dropna()
 283
 284        # If there has been any counter reset, the difference will be negative
 285        mask = df['delta_energy'] < 0
 286        df.loc[mask, 'delta_energy'] = 0 # In those cases, set the difference to 0
 287
 288        return df
 289

 291    async def hourly_energy_dataframe(self, entity_id, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 292        """Create a DataFrame with hourly energy data."""
 293        # Create the SQL query to get the energy data. NaN values are filled with the last known value
 294        query = await self.energy_query_string(entity_id, start, end)
 295
 296        # Create a DataFrame with the energy data obtained from InfluxDB
 297        df = await self.df_from_influxdb(query)
 298
 299        # If no data was obtained, return an empty DataFrame
 300        if df is None or df.empty:
 301            return pd.DataFrame()  
 302        
 303        # Rename the column energy_kWh to delta_energy
 304        df.rename(columns={'energy_kWh': 'delta_energy'}, inplace=True)
 305
 306        # Handle NaN values that may appear as a result of 
 307        # a date range wider than the available data
 308        df.fillna(0, inplace=True)  # Fill NaN values with 0
 309
 310        return df

 312    async def energy_total_in_df_by_date(self, df, selected_date) -> float:
 313        """Return the total energy consumed in a DataFrame for a selected date."""
 314        if df is None or df.empty:
 315            return 0.0
 316        
 317        # Create the start and end date for the selection
 318        start = selected_date.replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0)
 319        end = selected_date.replace(hour=23, minute=59, second=59, microsecond=0)
 320        
 321        # Select the energy data for the selected date
 322        df = df[start:end]
 323        
 324        # If no data was obtained, return 0.0
 325        if df is None or df.empty:
 326            return 0.0
 327        else:
 328            return df['delta_energy'].sum()

 331    async def get_history_solar_production_df(self, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 332        """Get the historical solar production DataFrame."""
 333        # Get the name for the query from self._solar_production_sensor
 334        entity_id = self._solar_production_sensor.split('.')[1]
 335        df_solar_production = await self.hourly_delta_energy_dataframe(entity_id, start=start, end=end)
 336        
 337        if df_solar_production.empty:
 338            # If no data was obtained, generate a DataFrame with 0 values
 339            end_datetime = datetime.now() if end is None else pd.to_datetime(end)
 340            start_datetime = end_datetime - timedelta(days=HISTORY_SOLAR_MAX_DAYS) if start is None else pd.to_datetime(start)
 341            
 342            # Create a DataFrame with 0 values                
 343            df_solar_production = await self.make_hourly_df_between_dates(start_datetime, end_datetime, 0.0)
 344            df_solar_production.rename(columns={'value': 'delta_energy'}, inplace=True)
 345            
 346            return df_solar_production
 347        
 348        return pd.DataFrame(df_solar_production, columns=['delta_energy']) 
 349
 350    async def get_history_forecast_solar_df(self, start=None, end=None) -> pd.DataFrame:
 351        """Get the historical solar forecast DataFrame."""
 352        # Get the name for the query from self._hystory_forecast_solar_sensor
 353        entity_id = self._hystory_forecast_solar_sensor.split('.')[1]
 354        df_forecast_solar = await self.hourly_energy_dataframe(entity_id, start=start, end=end)
 355        
 356        if df_forecast_solar.empty: 
 357            # If no data was obtained, generate a DataFrame with 0 values
 358            end_datetime = datetime.now() if end is None else pd.to_datetime(end)
 359            start_datetime = end_datetime - timedelta(days=HISTORY_SOLAR_MAX_DAYS) if start is None else pd.to_datetime(start)
 360            
 361            # Create a DataFrame with 0 values                
 362            df_forecast_solar = await self.make_hourly_df_between_dates(start_datetime, end_datetime, 0.0)
 363            df_forecast_solar.rename(columns={'value': 'delta_energy'}, inplace=True)
 364            
 365            return df_forecast_solar
 366        
 367        return pd.DataFrame(df_forecast_solar, columns=['delta_energy'])

 369    async def update_influxdb(self, start=None, end=None, force_update: bool = False) -> bool:
 370        """Update InfluxDB data."""
 371        # Check if more than INFLUX_UPDATE_INTERVAL has passed since the last update
 372        if self.influx_last_update is not None \
 373            and (datetime.now() - self.influx_last_update < INFLUX_UPDATE_INTERVAL) \
 374            and not force_update:
 375            _LOGGER.debug("InfluxDB data is still valid") 
 376            return True
 377        
 378        _LOGGER.debug("InfluxDB data needs to be updated") 
 379        
 380        current_datetime = datetime.now()
 381        success=True # This check comes from the original code. It is not clear if it is necessary
 382        
 383        # Update historical solar production data only once a day
 384        if self.last_history_solar_production_update is None \
 385            or (current_datetime.date() - self.last_history_solar_production_update.date() > timedelta(days=1)): 
 386            previous_day = current_datetime - timedelta(days=1)
 387            solar_start = previous_day - timedelta(days=HISTORY_SOLAR_MAX_DAYS)
 388            
 389            # Update historical solar production data
 390            self.df_history_solar_production = await self.get_history_solar_production_df(start=solar_start, end=previous_day)
 391            
 392            # Update historical solar forecast data
 393            self.df_hystory_forecast_solar = await self.get_history_forecast_solar_df(start=solar_start, end=previous_day)
 394            
 395            # Get the solar production of the last day
 396            self.history_solar_production_last_day_Wh = await self.energy_total_in_df_by_date(self.df_history_solar_production, previous_day)
 397            self.history_solar_production_last_day_Wh *= 1000  # Convert from kWh to Wh
 398            
 399            # Get the solar forecast of the last day
 400            self.hystory_forecast_solar_last_day_Wh = await self.energy_total_in_df_by_date(self.df_hystory_forecast_solar, previous_day)
 401            self.hystory_forecast_solar_last_day_Wh *= 1000  # Convert from kWh to Wh
 402            
 403            await self.compare_solar_production_forecast()
 404            self.last_history_solar_production_update = current_datetime
 405
 406            success = len(self.df_history_solar_production) > 0 and len(self.df_hystory_forecast_solar) > 0
 407
 408        if success:
 409            self.influx_last_update = datetime.now()
 410            _LOGGER.debug("Solar production data updated at {} from InfluxDB".format(self.influx_last_update))
 411            _LOGGER.debug(f"history_solar_production_last_day Wh: {self.history_solar_production_last_day_Wh}")
 412            _LOGGER.debug(f"hystory_forecast_solar_last_day Wh: {self.hystory_forecast_solar_last_day_Wh}")
 413
 414            return True            
 415        else:
 416            _LOGGER.debug("Failed to obtain data from InfluxDB")
 417            return False
